channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report E-2024010531
item.description:
Report E-2024010531

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Veolia employee was moving a pallet of drums onto a trailer using a forklift at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Kansas City. There was a slight bump as he was driving onto the trailer which resulted in one of the drums falling off the pallet being carried by the forklift. The drum had an older ring on the lid which broke as a result of the fall. Approximately 2 pounds of the waste inside the drum spilled onto the trailer floor. The spill was contained inside the trailer, was immediately cleaned up and the team replaced the ring and lid for the drum with a new one.

item.title: Report X-2024010674
item.description:
Report X-2024010674

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-30T15:10:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-01
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered to be leaking upon being unloaded from the trailer that it was on. Upon discovery, package was placed in a hazmat bag and tote and relocated to the damaged hazmat cage to await further processing. DescribePack: A seal that is supposed to be under the cap on one of the jerricans is not present. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed upright and a neutralizing agent was used on the spill and then cleaned.

item.title: Report E-2024020005
item.description:
Report E-2024020005

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver had just completed loading Compartment 1, and when disconnecting the load arm the External valve stuck open spilling about 10 gallons of Truck Diesel into containment at the loading rack.
